00083 std::string
00084 MemoryMap::Buffer::new_name()
00085 {
00086     std::string retval;
00087     static size_t ncalls = 0;
00088 
00089     retval += 'a' + (ncalls/(26*26))%26;
00090     retval += 'a' + (ncalls/26)%26;
00091     retval += 'a' + (ncalls%26);
00092     ++ncalls;
00093     return retval;
00094 }

00096 void
00097 MemoryMap::Buffer::save(const std::string &filename) const
00098 {
00099     std::ofstream file(filename.c_str(), std::ofstream::binary);
00100 
00101     rose_addr_t offset=0;
00102     char buf[8192];
00103 
00104     while (true) {
00105         size_t n = read(buf, offset, sizeof buf);
00106         file.write(buf, n);
00107         if (file.bad() || n<sizeof buf)
00108             break;
00109     }
00110 }
00111 
00112 bool
00113 MemoryMap::Buffer::is_zero() const
00114 {
00115     uint8_t buf[8192];
00116     size_t at = 0;
00117     while (at<size()) {
00118         size_t n = std::min(size()-at, sizeof buf);
00119         size_t nread = read(buf, at, n);
00120         assert(nread==n);
00121         for (size_t i=0; i<nread; ++i) {
00122             if (buf[i]!=0)
00123                 return false;
00124         }
00125         at += nread;
00126     }
00127     return true;
00128 }

00165 size_t
00166 MemoryMap::ExternBuffer::read(void *buf, size_t offset, size_t nbytes) const
00167 {
00168     if (!p_data || offset>=size())
00169         return 0;
00170     size_t n = std::min(nbytes, size()-offset);
00171     if (buf)
00172         memcpy(buf, (uint8_t*)p_data+offset, n);
00173     return n;
00174 }

00176 size_t
00177 MemoryMap::ExternBuffer::write(const void *buf, size_t offset, size_t nbytes)
00178 {
00179     if (!p_data || is_read_only() || offset>=size())
00180         return 0;
00181     size_t n = std::min(nbytes, size()-offset);
00182     if (buf)
00183         memcpy((uint8_t*)p_data+offset, buf, n);
00184     return n;

00193 MemoryMap::BufferPtr
00194 MemoryMap::ByteBuffer::create_from_file(const std::string &filename, size_t offset)
00195 {
00196     // Open file and seek to starting offset
00197     int fd = open(filename.c_str(), O_RDONLY);
00198     if (fd<0)
00199         return BufferPtr();
00200     struct stat sb;
00201     if (fstat(fd, &sb)<0) {
00202         close(fd);
00203         return BufferPtr();
00204     }
00205     off_t position = lseek(fd, offset, SEEK_SET);
00206     if (-1==position || (rose_addr_t)position!=offset) {
00207         close(fd);
00208         return BufferPtr();
00209     }
00210 
00211     // Read data from file until EOF
00212     rose_addr_t size = offset > (size_t)sb.st_size ? 0 : sb.st_size-offset;
00213     uint8_t *data = new uint8_t[size];
00214 #ifndef _MSC_VER
00215     ssize_t n = TEMP_FAILURE_RETRY(::read(fd, data, size));
00216 #else
00217     ROSE_ASSERT(!"lacking Windows support");
00218 #endif
00219     if (-1==n || n!=sb.st_size) {
00220         delete[] data;
00221         close(fd);
00222         return BufferPtr();
00223     }
00224     close(fd);
00225 
00226     // Create the buffer
00227     return create(data, size);
00228 }

00246 size_t
00247 MemoryMap::AnonymousBuffer::read(void *buf, size_t offset, size_t nbytes) const
00248 {
00249     if (offset>=size())
00250         return 0;
00251     size_t n = std::min(nbytes, size()-offset);
00252     if (buf) {
00253         if (p_data) {
00254             memcpy(buf, (uint8_t*)p_data+offset, n);
00255         } else {
00256             memset(buf, 0, n);
00257         }
00258     }
00259     return n;
00260 }
00261 
00262 size_t
00263 MemoryMap::AnonymousBuffer::write(const void *buf, size_t offset, size_t nbytes)
00264 {
00265     if (offset>=size())
00266         return 0;
00267     size_t n = std::min(nbytes, size()-offset);
00268     if (buf) {
00269         if (!p_data) {
00270             bool all_zero = true;
00271             for (size_t i=0; i<n && all_zero; ++i)
00272                 all_zero = ((uint8_t*)buf)[i] == '\0';
00273             if (all_zero)
00274                 return n;
00275             p_data = new uint8_t[size()];
00276             memset(p_data, 0, size());
00277         }
00278         memcpy((uint8_t*)p_data+offset, buf, n);
00279     }
00280     return n;
00281 }
00282 
00283 const void *
00284 MemoryMap::AnonymousBuffer::get_data_ptr() const
00285 {
00286     if (!p_data) {
00287         p_data = new uint8_t[size()];
00288         memset(p_data, 0, size());
00289     }
00290     return ExternBuffer::get_data_ptr();
00291 }

00299 MemoryMap::BufferPtr
00300 MemoryMap::MmapBuffer::create(const std::string &filename, int oflags, int mprot, int mflags)
00301 {
00302     int fd = open(filename.c_str(), oflags, 0666);
00303     if (fd<0)
00304         throw Exception(filename + ": " + strerror(errno), NULL);
00305     struct stat sb;
00306     int status = fstat(fd, &sb);
00307     if (status<0)
00308         throw Exception(filename + ": " + strerror(errno), NULL);
00309     BufferPtr buffer;
00310     try {
00311         buffer = create(sb.st_size, mprot, mflags, fd, 0);
00312     } catch (...) {
00313         close(fd);
00314         return BufferPtr();
00315     }
00316     close(fd);
00317     return buffer;
00318 }

00320 MemoryMap::BufferPtr
00321 MemoryMap::MmapBuffer::create(size_t length, int prot, int flags, int fd, off_t offset)
00322 {
00323     void *buf = mmap(NULL, length, prot, flags, fd, 0);
00324     if (MAP_FAILED==buf)
00325         throw Exception(strerror(errno), NULL);
00326     return BufferPtr(new MmapBuffer((uint8_t*)buf, length, 0==(flags & PROT_WRITE)));
00327 }

00344 /******************************************************************************************************************************
00345  *                                      Segment methods

00347 
00348 bool
00349 MemoryMap::Segment::check(const Extent &range, rose_addr_t *first_bad_va/*=NULL=*/) const
00350 {
00351     if (range.empty()) {
00352         if (first_bad_va)
00353             *first_bad_va = 0;
00354         return false;
00355     }
00356     if (!get_buffer() || 0==get_buffer()->size() || get_buffer_offset() >= get_buffer()->size()) {
00357         if (first_bad_va)
00358             *first_bad_va = range.first();
00359         return false;
00360     }
00361     if (get_buffer_offset() + range.size() > get_buffer()->size()) {
00362         if (first_bad_va)
00363             *first_bad_va = range.first() + (get_buffer()->size() - get_buffer_offset());
00364         return false;
00365     }
00366 
00367     return true;
00368 }
00369 
00370 rose_addr_t
00371 MemoryMap::Segment::get_buffer_offset(const Extent &my_range, rose_addr_t va) const
00372 {
00373     assert(my_range.contains(Extent(va)));
00374     return get_buffer_offset() + va - my_range.first();
00375 }

00383 
00384 std::string
00385 MemoryMap::Segment::get_name_pairings(NamePairings *pairings) const
00386 {
00387     assert(pairings!=NULL);
00388     std::string retval;
00389     std::string::size_type i = 0;
00390     while (i<name.size()) {
00391         /* Extract the file name up to the left paren */
00392         while (i<name.size() && isspace(name[i])) i++;
00393         std::string::size_type fname_start = i;
00394         while (i<name.size() && !isspace(name[i]) && !strchr("()+", name[i])) i++;
00395         if (i>=name.size() || '('!=name[i] || fname_start==i) {
00396             retval += name.substr(fname_start, i-fname_start);
00397             break;
00398         }
00399         std::string fname = name.substr(fname_start, i-fname_start);
00400         i++; /*skip over the left paren*/
00401         int parens=0;
00402         
00403         /* Extract name(s) separated from one another by '+' */
00404         while (i<name.size() && ')'!=name[i]) {
00405             while (i<name.size() && isspace(name[i])) i++;
00406             std::string::size_type gname_start = i;
00407             while (i<name.size() && '+'!=name[i] && (parens>0 || ')'!=name[i])) {
00408                 if ('('==name[i]) {
00409                     parens++;
00410                 } else if (')'==name[i]) {
00411                     parens--;
00412                 } 
00413                 i++;
00414             }
00415             if (i>gname_start)
00416                 (*pairings)[fname].insert(name.substr(gname_start, i-gname_start));
00417             if (i<name.size() && '+'==name[i]) i++;
00418         }
00419 
00420         /* Skip over right paren and optional space and '+' */
00421         if (i<name.size() && ')'==name[i]) i++;
00422         while (i<name.size() && isspace(name[i])) i++;
00423         if (i<name.size() && '+'==name[i]) i++;
00424     }
00425     if (i<name.size())
00426         retval += name.substr(i);
00427     return retval;
00428 }
00429 
00430 void
00431 MemoryMap::Segment::set_name(const NamePairings &pairings, const std::string &s1, const std::string &s2)
00432 {
00433     std::string s;
00434     for (NamePairings::const_iterator pi=pairings.begin(); pi!=pairings.end(); ++pi) {
00435         s += (s.empty()?"":"+") + pi->first + "(";
00436         for (std::set<std::string>::const_iterator si=pi->second.begin(); si!=pi->second.end(); ++si) {
00437             if ('('!=s[s.size()-1]) s += "+";
00438             s += *si;
00439         }
00440         s += ')';
00441     }
00442     if (!s1.empty())
00443         s += (s.empty()?"":"+") + s1;
00444     if (!s2.empty())
00445         s += (s.empty()?"":"+") + s2;
00446     set_name(s);
00447 }
00448 
00449 void
00450 MemoryMap::Segment::merge_names(const Segment &other)
00451 {
00452     if (get_name().empty()) {
00453         set_name(other.get_name());
00454     } else if (other.get_name().empty() || 0==get_name().compare(other.get_name())) {
00455         /*void*/
00456     } else {
00457         NamePairings pairings;
00458         std::string s1 = get_name_pairings(&pairings);
00459         std::string s2 = other.get_name_pairings(&pairings);
00460         set_name(pairings, s1, s2);
00461     }
00462 }

00477 
00478 // RangeMap API
00479 bool
00480 MemoryMap::Segment::merge(const Extent &my_range, const Extent &other_range, const Segment &other)
00481 {
00482     assert(!my_range.empty() && !other_range.empty());
00483 
00484 #if 1 // Relaxed version: segments are compatible if they point to the same underlying "char*" buffer
00485     if (get_buffer()==NULL || other.get_buffer()==NULL)
00486         return false;
00487     if (get_buffer()->get_data_ptr()==NULL ||
00488         get_buffer()->get_data_ptr()!=other.get_buffer()->get_data_ptr())
00489         return false;
00490 #else // Strict version: compatible only if segments point to the same MemoryMap::Buffer (this is what we eventually want)
00491     if (get_buffer()!=other.get_buffer())
00492         return false;
00493 #endif
00494     if (get_mapperms()!=other.get_mapperms())
00495         return false;
00496 
00497     if (other_range.abuts_lt(my_range)) {
00498         if (other.get_buffer_offset(other_range, other_range.last()) + 1 != get_buffer_offset(my_range, my_range.first()))
00499             return false;
00500         set_buffer_offset(other.get_buffer_offset());
00501     } else {
00502         assert(other_range.abuts_gt(my_range));
00503         if (get_buffer_offset(my_range, my_range.last()) + 1 != other.get_buffer_offset(other_range, other_range.first()))
00504             return false;
00505     }
00506 
00507     merge_names(other);
00508     return true; // "other" is now a duplicate and will be removed from the map
00509 }
00510 
00511 MemoryMap::Segment
00512 MemoryMap::Segment::split(const Extent &range, rose_addr_t new_end)
00513 {
00514     Segment right = *this;
00515     right.set_buffer_offset(get_buffer_offset() + new_end-range.first());
00516     return right;
00517 }
00518 
00519 // does not compare segment names
00520 bool
00521 MemoryMap::Segment::operator==(const Segment &other) const
00522 {
00523     return (get_buffer()        == other.get_buffer() &&
00524             get_buffer_offset() == other.get_buffer_offset() &&
00525             get_mapperms()      == other.get_mapperms());
00526 }
00527 
00528 void
00529 MemoryMap::Segment::print(std::ostream &o) const
00530 {
00531     std::string bufname = buffer->get_name();
00532     if (bufname.find_first_of(" \t\n()")==std::string::npos)
00533         bufname = "buffer " + bufname;
00534 
00535     o <<(0==(get_mapperms() & MM_PROT_READ)    ? "-" : "r")
00536       <<(0==(get_mapperms() & MM_PROT_WRITE)   ? "-" : "w")
00537       <<(0==(get_mapperms() & MM_PROT_EXEC)    ? "-" : "x")
00538       <<(0==(get_mapperms() & MM_PROT_PRIVATE) ? "-" : "p")
00539       <<" at " <<(bufname+std::string(12, ' ')).substr(0, 12)
00540       <<" + " <<StringUtility::addrToString(get_buffer_offset());
00541 
00542     if (!get_name().empty()) {
00543         static const size_t limit = 55;
00544         std::string name = escapeString(get_name());
00545         if (name.size()>limit)
00546             name = name.substr(0, limit-3) + "...";
00547         o <<" " <<name;
00548     }
00549 }

00551 /******************************************************************************************************************************
00552  *                                      MemoryMap methods

00554 
00555 void
00556 MemoryMap::clear()
00557 {
00558     p_segments.clear();
00559 }
00560 
00561 MemoryMap&
00562 MemoryMap::init(const MemoryMap &other, CopyLevel copy_level)
00563 {
00564     p_segments = other.p_segments;
00565 
00566     switch (copy_level) {
00567         case COPY_SHALLOW:
00568             // nothing more to do
00569             break;
00570         case COPY_DEEP:
00571             for (Segments::iterator si=p_segments.begin(); si!=p_segments.end(); ++si) {
00572                 si->second.clear_cow();
00573                 si->second.set_buffer(si->second.get_buffer()->clone());
00574             }
00575             break;
00576         case COPY_ON_WRITE:
00577             for (Segments::iterator si=p_segments.begin(); si!=p_segments.end(); ++si)
00578                 si->second.set_cow();
00579             break;
00580     }
00581     return *this;
00582 }
00583 
00584 void
00585 MemoryMap::insert(const Extent &range, const Segment &segment, bool erase_prior)
00586 {
00587     Segments::iterator inserted = p_segments.insert(range, segment, erase_prior);
00588     if (inserted==p_segments.end()) {
00589         // If the insertion failed, then we need to throw an exception.  The exception should indicate the lowest address at
00590         // which there was a conflict.  I.e., the first mapped address above range.first().
00591         Segments::iterator found = p_segments.lower_bound(range.first());
00592         assert(found!=p_segments.end());
00593         assert(range.overlaps(found->first));
00594         throw Inconsistent("insertion failed", this, range, segment, found->first, found->second);
00595     }
00596 }
00597 
00598 bool
00599 MemoryMap::exists(Extent range, unsigned required_perms) const
00600 {
00601     if (!p_segments.contains(range))
00602         return false;
00603     if (0==required_perms)
00604         return true;
00605 
00606     while (!range.empty()) {
00607         Segments::const_iterator found = p_segments.find(range.first());
00608         assert(found!=p_segments.end()); // because p_segments.contains(range)
00609         const Extent &found_range = found->first;
00610         const Segment &found_segment = found->second;
00611         assert(!range.begins_before(found_range)); // ditto
00612         if ((found_segment.get_mapperms() & required_perms) != required_perms)
00613             return false;
00614         if (found_range.last() >= range.last())
00615             return true;
00616         range = Extent::inin(found_range.last()+1, range.last());
00617     }
00618     return true;
00619 }
00620 
00621 void
00622 MemoryMap::erase(const Extent &range)
00623 {
00624     p_segments.erase(range);
00625 }
00626 
00627 void
00628 MemoryMap::erase(const Segment &segment)
00629 {
00630     for (Segments::iterator si=p_segments.begin(); si!=p_segments.end(); ++si) {
00631         if (segment==si->second) {
00632             erase(si->first);
00633             return;
00634         }
00635     }
00636 }
00637 
00638 std::pair<Extent, MemoryMap::Segment>
00639 MemoryMap::at(rose_addr_t va) const
00640 {
00641     Segments::const_iterator found = p_segments.find(va);
00642     if (found==p_segments.end())
00643         throw NotMapped("", this, va);
00644     return *found;
00645 }
00646 
00647 rose_addr_t
00648 MemoryMap::find_free(rose_addr_t start_va, size_t size, rose_addr_t alignment) const
00649 {
00650     ExtentMap free_map = p_segments.invert<ExtentMap>();
00651     ExtentMap::iterator fmi = free_map.lower_bound(start_va);
00652     while ((fmi=free_map.first_fit(size, fmi)) != free_map.end()) {
00653         Extent free_range = fmi->first;
00654         rose_addr_t free_va = ALIGN_UP(free_range.first(), alignment);
00655         rose_addr_t free_sz = free_va > free_range.last() ? 0 : free_range.last()+1-free_va;
00656         if (free_sz > size)
00657             return free_va;
00658         ++fmi;
00659     }
00660     throw NoFreeSpace("find_free() failed", this, size);
00661 }
00662 
00663 rose_addr_t
00664 MemoryMap::find_last_free(rose_addr_t max) const
00665 {
00666     ExtentMap free_map = p_segments.invert<ExtentMap>();
00667     ExtentMap::iterator fmi = free_map.find_prior(max);
00668     if (fmi==free_map.end())
00669         throw NoFreeSpace("find_last_free() failed", this, 1);
00670     return fmi->first.first();
00671 }
00672 
00673 void
00674 MemoryMap::traverse(Visitor &visitor) const
00675 {
00676     for (Segments::const_iterator si=p_segments.begin(); si!=p_segments.end(); ++si)
00677         (void) visitor(this, si->first, si->second);
00678 }
00679 
00680 void
00681 MemoryMap::prune(Visitor &predicate)
00682 {
00683     ExtentMap matches;
00684     for (Segments::iterator si=p_segments.begin(); si!=p_segments.end(); ++si) {
00685         if (predicate(this, si->first, si->second))
00686             matches.insert(si->first);
00687     }
00688 
00689     for (ExtentMap::iterator mi=matches.begin(); mi!=matches.end(); ++mi)
00690         p_segments.erase(mi->first);
00691 }
00692 
00693 void
00694 MemoryMap::prune(unsigned required, unsigned prohibited)
00695 {
00696     struct T1: public Visitor {
00697         unsigned required, prohibited;
00698         T1(unsigned required, unsigned prohibited): required(required), prohibited(prohibited) {}
00699         bool operator()(const MemoryMap*, const Extent &range, const Segment &segment) {
00700             return ((0!=required && 0==(segment.get_mapperms() & required)) ||
00701                     0!=(segment.get_mapperms() & prohibited));
00702         }
00703     } predicate(required, prohibited);
00704     prune(predicate);
00705 }
00706 
00707 size_t
00708 MemoryMap::read1(void *dst_buf/*=NULL*/, rose_addr_t start_va, size_t desired, unsigned req_perms) const
00709 {
00710     Segments::const_iterator found = p_segments.find(start_va);
00711     if (found==p_segments.end())
00712         return 0;
00713 
00714     const Extent &range = found->first;
00715     assert(range.contains(Extent(start_va)));
00716 
00717     desired = std::min((rose_addr_t)desired, (range.last()-start_va)+1);
00718 
00719     const Segment &segment = found->second;
00720     if ((segment.get_mapperms() & req_perms) != req_perms || !segment.check(range))
00721         return 0;
00722 
00723     rose_addr_t buffer_offset = segment.get_buffer_offset(range, start_va);
00724     return segment.get_buffer()->read(dst_buf, buffer_offset, desired);
00725 }
00726 
00727 size_t
00728 MemoryMap::read(void *dst_buf/*=NULL*/, rose_addr_t start_va, size_t desired, unsigned req_perms) const
00729 {
00730     size_t total_copied = 0;
00731     while (total_copied < desired) {
00732         uint8_t *ptr = dst_buf ? (uint8_t*)dst_buf + total_copied : NULL;
00733         size_t n = read1(ptr, start_va+total_copied, desired-total_copied, req_perms);
00734         if (0==n) break;
00735         total_copied += n;
00736     }
00737     memset((uint8_t*)dst_buf+total_copied, 0, desired-total_copied);
00738     return total_copied;
00739 }
00740 
00741 SgUnsignedCharList
00742 MemoryMap::read(rose_addr_t va, size_t desired, unsigned req_perms) const
00743 {
00744     SgUnsignedCharList retval;
00745     while (desired>0) {
00746         size_t can_read = read1(NULL, va, desired, req_perms);
00747         if (0==can_read)
00748             break;
00749         size_t n = retval.size();
00750         retval.resize(retval.size()+can_read);
00751         size_t did_read = read1(&retval[n], va, desired, req_perms);
00752         assert(did_read==can_read);
00753 
00754         va += did_read;
00755         desired -= can_read;
00756     }
00757     return retval;
00758 }
00759 
00760 size_t
00761 MemoryMap::write1(const void *src_buf/*=NULL*/, rose_addr_t start_va, size_t desired, unsigned req_perms)
00762 {
00763     Segments::iterator found = p_segments.find(start_va);
00764     if (found==p_segments.end())
00765         return 0;
00766 
00767     const Extent &range = found->first;
00768     assert(range.contains(Extent(start_va)));
00769 
00770     Segment &segment = found->second;
00771     if ((segment.get_mapperms() & req_perms) != req_perms || !segment.check(range))
00772         return 0;
00773 
00774     if (segment.is_cow()) {
00775         BufferPtr old_buf = segment.get_buffer();
00776         BufferPtr new_buf = old_buf->clone();
00777         for (Segments::iterator si=p_segments.begin(); si!=p_segments.end(); ++si) {
00778             if (si->second.get_buffer()==old_buf) {
00779                 si->second.set_buffer(new_buf);
00780                 si->second.clear_cow();
00781             }
00782         }
00783         assert(segment.get_buffer()==new_buf);
00784         assert(!segment.is_cow());
00785     }
00786 
00787     rose_addr_t buffer_offset = segment.get_buffer_offset(range, start_va);
00788     return segment.get_buffer()->write(src_buf, buffer_offset, desired);
00789 }
00790 
00791 size_t
00792 MemoryMap::write(const void *src_buf/*=NULL*/, rose_addr_t start_va, size_t desired, unsigned req_perms)
00793 {
00794     size_t total_copied = 0;
00795     while (total_copied < desired) {
00796         uint8_t *ptr = src_buf ? (uint8_t*)src_buf + total_copied : NULL;
00797         size_t n = write1(ptr, start_va+total_copied, desired-total_copied, req_perms);
00798         if (0==n) break;
00799         total_copied += n;
00800     }
00801     return total_copied;
00802 }
00803 
00804 ExtentMap
00805 MemoryMap::va_extents() const
00806 {
00807     return ExtentMap(p_segments);
00808 }
00809 
00810 void
00811 MemoryMap::mprotect(Extent range, unsigned perms, bool relax)
00812 {
00813     bool done = false;
00814     while (!range.empty() && !done) {
00815         Segments::iterator found = p_segments.lower_bound(range.first());
00816 
00817         // Skip over leading part of range that's not mapped
00818         if (found==p_segments.end() || found->first.right_of(range)) {
00819             if (!relax)
00820                 throw NotMapped("", this, range.first());
00821             return;
00822         }
00823         if (found->first.begins_after(range)) {
00824             if (!relax)
00825                 throw NotMapped("", this, range.first());
00826             range = Extent::inin(found->first.first(), range.last());
00827         }
00828 
00829         Segment &segment = found->second;
00830         const Extent segment_range = found->first; // don't use a reference; it might be deleted by MemoryMap::insert() below
00831         done = segment_range.last() >= range.last();
00832 
00833         if (found->second.get_mapperms()!=perms) {
00834             if (range.contains(segment_range)) {
00835                 // we can just change the segment in place
00836                 segment.set_mapperms(perms);
00837             } else {
00838                 // make a hole and insert a new segment
00839                 assert(segment_range.begins_before(range, false/*non-strict*/));
00840                 Extent new_range = Extent::inin(range.first(), std::min(range.last(), segment_range.last()));
00841                 Segment new_segment = segment;
00842                 new_segment.set_mapperms(perms);
00843                 new_segment.set_buffer_offset(segment.get_buffer_offset(segment_range, new_range.first()));
00844                 p_segments.insert(new_range, new_segment, true/*make hole*/); // 'segment' is now invalid
00845             }
00846         }
00847 
00848         if (!done)
00849             range = Extent::inin(segment_range.last()+1, range.last());
00850     }
00851 }
00852 
00853 void
00854 MemoryMap::dump(FILE *f, const char *prefix) const
00855 {
00856     std::ostringstream ss;
00857     dump(ss, prefix);
00858     fputs(ss.str().c_str(), f);
00859 }
00860 
00861 void
00862 MemoryMap::dump(std::ostream &out, std::string prefix) const
00863 {
00864     if (0==p_segments.size()) {
00865         out <<prefix <<"empty\n";
00866         return;
00867     }
00868 
00869     for (Segments::const_iterator si=p_segments.begin(); si!=p_segments.end(); ++si) {
00870         const Extent &range = si->first;
00871         const Segment &segment = si->second;
00872 
00873         assert(segment.get_buffer());
00874         std::string basename = segment.get_buffer()->get_name();
00875 
00876         out <<prefix
00877             <<"va " <<StringUtility::addrToString(range.first())
00878             <<" + " <<StringUtility::addrToString(range.size())
00879             <<" = " <<StringUtility::addrToString(range.last()+1) <<" "
00880             <<segment
00881             <<"\n";
00882     }
00883 }
00884 
00885 void
00886 MemoryMap::dump(const std::string &basename) const
00887 {
00888     std::ofstream index((basename+".index").c_str());
00889     index <<*this;
00890 
00891     for (Segments::const_iterator si=p_segments.begin(); si!=p_segments.end(); ++si) {
00892         const Extent &range = si->first;
00893         const Segment &segment = si->second;
00894 
00895         std::string dataname = basename + "-" + StringUtility::addrToString(range.first()).substr(2) + ".data";
00896         segment.get_buffer()->save(dataname);
00897     }
00898 }
00899 
00900 bool
00901 MemoryMap::load(const std::string &basename)
00902 {
00903     clear();
00904     std::string indexname = basename + ".index";
00905     FILE *f = fopen(indexname.c_str(), "r");
00906     if (!f) return false;
00907 
00908     char *line = NULL;
00909     size_t line_nalloc = 0;
00910     ssize_t nread;
00911     unsigned nlines=0;
00912     std::map<std::string, BufferPtr> buffers;
00913 
00914     while (0<(nread=rose_getline(&line, &line_nalloc, f))) {
00915         char *rest, *s=line;
00916         nlines++;
00917 
00918         /* Check for empty lines and comments */
00919         while (isspace(*s)) s++;
00920         if (!*s || '#'==*s) continue;
00921 
00922         /* Starting virtual address with optional "va " prefix */
00923         if (!strncmp(s, "va ", 3)) s += 3;
00924         errno = 0;
00925 #ifndef _MSC_VER
00926         rose_addr_t segment_va = strtoull(s, &rest, 0);
00927 #else
00928         rose_addr_t segment_va = 0;
00929         ROSE_ASSERT(!"lacking Windows support");
00930 #endif
00931         if (rest==s || errno)
00932             throw SyntaxError("starting virtual address expected", this, indexname, nlines, s-line);
00933         s = rest;
00934 
00935         /* Size, prefixed with optional "+" or "," */
00936         while (isspace(*s)) s++;
00937         if ('+'==*s || ','==*s) s++;
00938         while (isspace(*s)) s++;
00939         errno = 0;
00940 #ifndef _MSC_VER
00941         rose_addr_t segment_sz = strtoull(s, &rest, 0);
00942 #else
00943         rose_addr_t segment_sz = 0;
00944         ROSE_ASSERT(!"lacking Windows support");
00945 #endif
00946         if (rest==s || errno)
00947             throw SyntaxError("virtual size expected", this, indexname, nlines, s-line);
00948         s = rest;
00949 
00950         /* Optional ending virtual address prefixed with "=" */
00951         while (isspace(*s)) s++;
00952         if ('='==*s) {
00953             s++;
00954             errno = 0;
00955 #ifndef _MSC_VER
00956             (void)strtoull(s, &rest, 0);
00957 #else
00958             ROSE_ASSERT(!"lacking Windows support");
00959 #endif
00960             if (rest==s || errno)
00961                 throw SyntaxError("ending virtual address expected after '='", this, indexname, nlines, s-line);
00962             s = rest;
00963         }
00964 
00965         /* Permissions with optional ',' prefix. Permissions are the letters 'r', 'w', and/or 'x'. Hyphens can appear in the
00966          * r/w/x string at any position and are ignored. */
00967         while (isspace(*s)) s++;
00968         if (','==*s) s++;
00969         while (isspace(*s)) s++;
00970         unsigned perm = 0;
00971         while (strchr("rwxp-", *s)) {
00972             switch (*s++) {
00973                 case 'r': perm |= MM_PROT_READ; break;
00974                 case 'w': perm |= MM_PROT_WRITE; break;
00975                 case 'x': perm |= MM_PROT_EXEC; break;
00976                 case 'p': perm |= MM_PROT_PRIVATE; break;
00977                 case '-': break;
00978                 default: break; /*to suppress a compiler warning*/
00979             }
00980         }
00981 
00982         /* File or buffer name terminated by ',' or '0x' and then strip trailing space. */
00983         while (isspace(*s)) s++;
00984         if (','==*s) s++;
00985         while (isspace(*s)) s++;
00986         if (!strncmp(s, "at", 2) && isspace(s[2])) s+= 3;
00987         while (isspace(*s)) s++;
00988         int buffer_name_col = s-line;
00989         std::string buffer_name;
00990         while (*s && ','!=*s && 0!=strncmp(s, "0x", 2))
00991             buffer_name += *s++;
00992         size_t bnsz = buffer_name.size();
00993         while (bnsz>0 && isspace(buffer_name[bnsz-1])) --bnsz;
00994         buffer_name = buffer_name.substr(0, bnsz);
00995         if (buffer_name.empty())
00996             throw SyntaxError("file/buffer name expected", this, indexname, nlines, buffer_name_col);
00997 
00998         /* Offset from base address; optional prefix of "," or "+". */
00999         while (isspace(*s)) s++;
01000         if (','==*s || '+'==*s) s++;
01001         while (isspace(*s)) s++;
01002         errno = 0;
01003 #ifndef _MSC_VER
01004         rose_addr_t offset = strtoull(s, &rest, 0);
01005 #else
01006         rose_addr_t offset = 0;
01007         ROSE_ASSERT(!"lacking Windows support");
01008 #endif
01009         if (rest==s || errno)
01010             throw SyntaxError("file/buffer offset expected", this, indexname, nlines, s-line);
01011         s = rest;
01012 
01013         /* Comment (optional) */
01014         while (isspace(*s)) s++;
01015         if (','==*s) s++;
01016         while (isspace(*s)) s++;
01017         char *end = s + strlen(s);
01018         while (end>s && isspace(end[-1])) --end;
01019         std::string comment(s, end-s);
01020 
01021         /* Create the buffer or use one we already created. */
01022         BufferPtr buffer;
01023         std::map<std::string, BufferPtr>::iterator bi = buffers.find(buffer_name);
01024         if (bi!=buffers.end() && 0==(perm & MM_PROT_PRIVATE)) {
01025             buffer = bi->second;
01026         } else if (0==access(buffer_name.c_str(), F_OK)) {
01027             buffer = ByteBuffer::create_from_file(buffer_name);
01028             buffers.insert(std::make_pair(buffer_name, buffer));
01029         } else {
01030             ROSE_ASSERT(!"not implemented yet");
01031         }
01032 
01033         Extent range(segment_va, segment_sz);
01034         Segment segment(buffer, offset, perm, comment);
01035         insert(range, segment);
01036     }
01037 
01038     fclose(f);
01039     if (line) free(line);
01040     return nread<=0;
01041 }
